org.apache.directory.server.dhcp.options

Class BaseDhcpOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.directory.server.dhcp.options.BaseDhcpOption
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Dhcp6Option, DhcpOption

    public abstract class BaseDhcpOption
extends Object
    The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) provides a framework for passing configuration information to hosts on a TCP/IP network. Configuration parameters and other control information are carried in tagged data items that are stored in the 'options' field of the DHCP message. The data items themselves are also called "options." https://www.iana.org/assignments/bootp-dhcp-parameters/bootp-dhcp-parameters.xhtml

      • getData

        @Nonnull
public final byte[] getData()
        Get the data (wire format) into a byte array. Subclasses must provide an implementation which serializes the parsed data back into a byte array if they override setData(byte[]).
        Returns:
        byte[]

      • setData

        public final void setData(@Nonnull
           byte[] data)
        Set the data (wire format) from a byte array. The default implementation just records the data as a byte array. Subclasses may parse the data into something more meaningful.
        Parameters:
        data -
